original: Åstrand, Erik August, civilingenjör, fd. förste baningenjör, Nässjö, f. 3/2/81 i Sund, Östergötl. I., av överste August A. o. Hedvig Arehn. G. 13 m. Elsa Nathorst-Wästfelt. Barn: Per-Erik f. 14, ing., Sthlm, Bertil 24, Folke 29. — Stud:ex. i Jönköp. 01, avg:ex. fr. KTH (V) 06. Bitr. ing. h. dåv. löjtn. Ingemar Petersson 06-07, anst. v. övre norra väg- o. vattenibyggn :distr. 07, h. Linköip. stad 07-10, e. tj :m:an v. SJ 10-11, und :ing. 11, byggn :förest. v. Nässjö bangårds omjbyggn. 16, baninsp. 17, tf. sekt :ing. v. dubbelspårsbyggn. Tranås-Sävsjö 17-21, tjf. förste baning. i Kiruna 21-23, förste baning. där 23-25, baning. i Alvesta 25-26, i Nässjö 26-36, förste baning. i Nässjö 36-46. Pens. 46. Tillf. anst. s. baning. i Nässjö, Ystad o. Kristianstad 46. Led. av Nässjö byggn :nd 17-21. RVO 33.
translated:
This is the translation of the abbreviated Swedish biography:

Åstrand, Erik August, civil engineer, former chief railroad engineer, Nässjö, born on February 3, 1881 in Sund, Östergötland County, son of Colonel August A. and Hedvig Arehn. Married on the 13th of May with Elsa Nathorst-Wästfelt. Children: Per-Erik, born in 1914, engineer, residing in Stockholm, Bertil, born in 1924, and Folke, born in 1929. 

Education: Completed high school in Jönköping in 1901, graduated from Royal Institute of Technology (V) in 1906. Assistant engineer under Lieutenant Ingemar Petersson from 1906 to 1907, employed by the upper northern road and water construction district from 1907. Employed by Linköping municipality from 1907 to 1910, then became a civil servant at the Swedish State Railways from 1910 to 1911. Assistant engineer from 1911, construction supervisor for the reconstruction of Nässjö railway station in 1916, assistant inspector from 1917, temporarily acting section engineer for the construction of double tracks from Tranås to Sävsjö from 1917 to 1921. Temporarily acting chief railroad engineer in Kiruna from 1921 to 1923, chief railroad engineer there from 1923 to 1925, railroad engineer in Alvesta from 1925 to 1926, in Nässjö from 1926 to 1936, and chief railroad engineer in Nässjö from 1936 to 1946. Retired in 1946. 

Temporary employment in railroad engineering in Nässjö, Ystad, and Kristianstad in 1946. Member of Nässjö building committee from 1917 to 1921. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1933.
